title.narrative: Community and Economic Development for Livelihood Improvement Project in Northern Vietnam

description.narrative: Dev. need/problem/opportunity gap: Despite the rapid development of Vietnam recently during the last 25 years the poverty rate in the country at the end of 2013 is still very high (8%) especially in the mountainous and remote areas (39%) where live the eth nic minority groups. The province ranks fifth out of all 63 provinces in Vietnam.Project objective: this project will focus on Civil society strengthening and livelihoods improvement specifically targeting community-based organizations (CBOs) functioning c apacity building and sustainable economic development. The project will implement the following outputs:1. Community-based organization set up and functioning for the benefit of the local villagers and community development.2. Training provided in communit y development skills good governance relevant agriculture techniques market-oriented production project fundraising and management.3. Community Development Funds (CDF) provided for both community and household socio-economic development initiatives.Benefic iaries: The project will target approximately people 600 as well as 15 local government and mass organization officials (at least 50% are women) at commune district and province levels as direct beneficiaries and 6460 community members (50% female) as indi rect beneficiaries in Bao Lac district Cao Bang Province.New structure development: the project will set up the community development clubs (CDC) as a community-based organization (CBO). This CDC will collaborate with the current mass organization includin g Women?s Youth?s and Farmer?s Unions and Fatherland Front to work for the benefits of the local villagers.Cross-cutting issues including accountability and transparency participation gender equality child protection disability inclusion environment protec tion disaster preparedness and climate change mitigation will be integrated into the project activities during its design and implementation. Project key activities: 1. To set up 15 CDCs with participation of marginalized ethnic minority members2. CDC func tioning and managed by the CDC leaders for community and economic development 3. The capacity of key implementing partners 4. The capacity of CDC members 5. Awareness of and knowledge in other related social and environmental aspects of CDC members are imp roved to support the holistic and sustainable nature of of livelihood development6. Income generation schemes are are developed and piloted.
